Charter REview
  1. What’s Happening
    News & Information from the City of Sugar Land

  1. Vaccinate Against Measles

    Measles activity has spiked in our neighboring counties. Fort Bend County Health & Human Services recommends residents to vaccinate against measles.
    Learn more >>

  2. CIP Story Map

    The Capital Improvement Projects Map provides a geographical view of CIP projects currently underway.

  3. Join the Team!

    The City of Sugar Land is hiring! Visit our jobs page, see all open positions, and apply.

  4. Goal Measures Dashboard

    The Goal Measures Dashboard is an online tool that measures the city’s progress on attaining key outcomes for residents.
/CivicAlerts.aspx

Spotlight

  1. 2019 Election Guide


    The city of Sugar Land's 2019 election guide is now available. The election will take place on May 4, 2019.

    Know Your District


    New boundaries for single-member districts will be in effect for the May 4 general election. Prior to voting, residents are encouraged to determine if their address is located in an area that is affected by this adjustment. City district tools are available online.

Did You Know?

  1. City Offices Closed on Friday

     
    City offices will be closed for regular business on Friday, April 19, in observance of the Good Friday Holiday.

    Regular solid waste and recycling collection will take place.

    Sugar Land Voters


    If you prefer to vote by mail, the last day to receive an application for a ballot by mail is April 19, 2019. The Office of the City Secretary will be open for registered voters to turn in applications from 8 a.m. to 11 a.m. this Friday.

    For more information about the May 4 election visit: www.sugarlandtx.gov/Elections
